summary: A 2018 study in the American Journal of Public Health found that minority and low-income communities across the country are disproportionately exposed to industrial, waste disposal, or other facilities that emit harmful air pollution. Environmental justice efforts seek to address these and other disproportionate risks by involving these communities in environmental policy and ensuring fair treatment. title: ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE: Federal Agencies Could Benefit from a Strategic Approach to Assess Progress
